Helper functions¶

There are a number of helper functions to calculate various useful cosmological quantities.

Note

Some of the helper functions assume that observations concern the redshifted 21 cm line.

pynoise.helper_functions.lumdist(z, k=0)¶

Calculate the luminosity distance for redshift z

Parameters:
  • z (float or numpy array): the redshift or redshifts
Returns:
The luminosity distance(s) in Mpc
pynoise.helper_functions.zang(dl, z)¶

Calculate the angular size of an object.

Parameters:
  • dl (float): the physical size in kpc
  • z (float): the redshift of the object
Returns:
Angle in arcseconds
pynoise.helper_functions.cdist(z)¶

Calculate the comoving distance

Parameters:
z (float): redshift
Returns:
Comoving distance in Mpc
pynoise.helper_functions.cdist_to_z(dist)¶

Calculate the redshift correspoding to the given redshift.

Parameters:
  • dist (float): the distance in comoving Mpc
Returns:

redshift corresponding to the distance.

Uses a precalculated table for interpolation. Only valid for 0 < z < 100

pynoise.helper_functions.nu_to_z(nu21)¶

Convert 21 cm frequency in MHz to redshift

Parameters:
  • nu21 (float): redshifted 21 cm frequency in MHz
Returns:
Redshift
pynoise.helper_functions.z_to_nu(z)¶

Get the 21 cm frequency that corresponds to redshift z

Parameters:
  • z (float): redshifts
Returns:
redshifted 21 cm frequency in MHz
pynoise.helper_functions.nu_to_cdist(nu21)¶

Calculate the comoving distance to a given 21 cm frequency

Parameters:
  • nu21 (float): redshifted 21 cm frequency in MHz
Returns:
Comoving distance in Mpc
pynoise.helper_functions.uv_to_k(uv, z)¶

Convert a point in uv space to the corresponding k value.

Parameters:
  • uv (float): distance in uv space
  • z (float): redshift
Returns:
k value in Mpc^-1
pynoise.helper_functions.k_to_uv(k, z)¶

Convert a k value to the corresponding uv value

Parameters:
  • k (float): k value in Mpc^-1
  • z (float): redshift
Returns:
distance in uv space
pynoise.helper_functions.get_bandwidth(z_central, depth_comov)¶

Get the frequency difference between the near and far edge of a box.

Paremeters:
  • z_central (float): central redshift of the box
  • depth_comov (float): comoving depth of the box in Mpc
Returns:
Frequency difference between the near and far edge of the box in Mpc
pynoise.helper_functions.get_smoothed_slice(data, psf, periodic=False)¶

Smooth a data slice with a given point spread function

Parameters:
  • data (numpy array): the array to smooth. Must have dimensions NxN
  • psf (numpy array): the point spread function. Must have dimensions NxN
Kwargs:
  • periodic (bool): if True, the input data will be assumed to have

    periodic boundary conditions

Returns:
the smoothed array
pynoise.helper_functions.apply_psf(data, psf, los_axis=0, periodic=False)¶

Smooth a data array with a given point spread function

Parameters:
  • data (numpy array): the array to smooth. May have dimensions NxN or NxNxM
  • psf (numpy array): the point spread function. Must have dimensions NxN
Kwargs:
  • los_axis (int): if data is three-dimensional, this determines the

    frequency axis

  • periodic (bool): if True, the input data will be assumed to have

    periodic boundary conditions

Returns:
Smoothed box
pynoise.helper_functions.params_from_file(f)¶

Load (unpickle) parameters object from file f

Parameters:
  • f (binary file object or filename string): the file

to load from.

Returns:
The loaded object
pynoise.helper_functions.ldist(z)¶

This function is used for the integration in lumdist Only meant for internal use
